name: EventSource
description: The EventSource interface is used to receive server-sent events. It connects to a server over HTTP and receives events in text/event-stream format without closing the connection.

members.name: EventSource()
members.description: Creates a new EventSource from the given USVString.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: A USVString that represents the location of the remote resource serving the events/messages.

parameters.name: configuration Optional
parameters.description: Provides options to configure the new connection. The possible entries are: withCredentials, defaulting to false, indicating if CORS should be set to include credentials.

members.name: EventSource.readyState
members.description: A number representing the state of the connection. Possible values are CONNECTING (0), OPEN (1), or CLOSED (2).

members.name: EventSource.url
members.description: A DOMString representing the URL of the source.

members.name: EventSource.withCredentials
members.description: A Boolean indicating whether the EventSource object was instantiated with CORS credentials set (true), or not (false, the default).

members.name: EventSource.onerror
members.description: Is an EventHandler called when an error occurs and the error event is dispatched on an EventSource object.

members.name: EventSource.onmessage
members.description: Is an EventHandler called when a message event is received, that is when a message is coming from the source.

members.name: EventSource.onopen
members.description: Is an EventHandler called when an open event is received, that is when the connection was just opened.

members.name: EventSource.close()
members.description: Closes the connection, if any, and sets the readyState attribute to CLOSED. If the connection is already closed, the method does nothing.
